text: is a Japanese football player. She plays for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Iwabuchi began her international career in 2008 when she was selected for the Japan U-17 national team at the age of 15, and participated in the 2008 U-17 World Cup in New Zealand. The team was defeated in the quarterfinals but she was named the tournament's MVP (adidas Golden Ball).Perfect tens strike gold , FIFA.com A French team coach hailed her as a "future star of women's football."Japan's Mana from heaven , FIFA.com Iwabuchi was also awarded the "Asian Young Footballer of the Year" by the Asian Football Confederation in 2008. She joined the Japan national team for the EAFF Championship, held in early 2010, and debuted in the game against China. She scored her first goal against the Chinese Taipei in the same competition. In 2011, she played at the 2011 World Cup and Japan won the competition. She played as a substitute in the final against United States. She also played 2012 Summer Olympics and 2015 World Cup. Japan got second place at both tournaments. In 2018, at 2018 Asian Cup, she played in all matches and scored 2 goals.
